forkee.name: kube-state-metrics
forkee.description: Add-on agent to generate and expose cluster-level metrics.

issue.title: Strange value for kube_statefulset_status_replicas_current

labels.name: help wanted
labels.description: Denotes an issue that needs help from a contributor. Must meet "help wanted" guidelines.

labels.name: kind/bug
labels.description: Categorizes issue or PR as related to a bug.

labels.name: lifecycle/rotten
labels.description: Denotes an issue or PR that has aged beyond stale and will be auto-closed.

issue.body:
Strange value for kube_statefulset_status_replicas_current. I believe this is related to: https://github.com/kubernetes/kube-state-metrics/issues/1057

I run into this with a prometheus alert that does `(kube_statefulset_status_replicas_ready / kube_statefulset_status_replicas_current) != 1`

On one of our clusters, `kube_statefulset_status_replicas_current` has value `0` for one of our services, even though it should be 2 by all accounts.

`kubectl describe` is producing the same values on both clusters.

```
Replicas:           2 desired | 2 total
Update Strategy:    OnDelete
Pods Status:        2 Running / 0 Waiting / 0 Succeeded / 0 Failed
```

**Environment**:
- kube-state-metrics version: `quay.io/coreos/kube-state-metrics:v1.9.7`
- Kubernetes version (use `kubectl version`): `Client Version: version.Info{Major:"1", Minor:"20", GitVersion:"v1.20.0", GitCommit:"af46c47ce925f4c4ad5cc8d1fca46c7b77d13b38", GitTreeState:"clean", BuildDate:"2020-12-08T17:59:43Z", GoVersion:"go1.15.5", Compiler:"gc", Platform:"linux/amd64"}
Server Version: version.Info{Major:"1", Minor:"17+", GitVersion:"v1.17.14-gke.1200", GitCommit:"7c407f5cc8632f9af5a2657f220963aa7f1c46e7", GitTreeState:"clean", BuildDate:"2020-12-01T09:20:59Z", GoVersion:"go1.13.15b4", Compiler:"gc", Platform:"linux/amd64"}`
- Cloud provider or hardware configuration: gCloud

comment.body:
Hello! @dgrisonnet 
>The official kubernetes documentation for the OnDelete strategy [2] could also be quoted to mention that this issue can be fixed by manually deleting the pod after updating the statefulset.

I don't think that will do the trick, statefulset controller only update `CurrentRevision` equal with `UpdateRevision` when [`UpdateStrategy` is RollingUpdate and all pods are updated](https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/blob/6fed03ea91627185afd4976474a396f17689f0d7/pkg/controller/statefulset/stateful_set_utils.go#L589C20-L589C20). Issue still open in [kubernetes](https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/issues/106055).

What do you think about counting `kube_statefulset_status_replicas_current` with `status.updatedReplicas+status.currentReplicas` instead of using `status.currentReplicas` or `status.updatedReplicas` alone when they are not equal?
Since that indicates statefulset been updated and I think users can consider pods with both revision are good ones.

issue.title: Support for Unknown status condition in Custom Resources

labels.name: kind/feature
labels.description: Categorizes issue or PR as related to a new feature.

labels.name: triage/accepted
labels.description: Indicates an issue or PR is ready to be actively worked on.

issue.body:
<!-- Please only use this template for submitting feature requests -->

**What would you like to be added**:
Improve support for producing a gauge for the status conditions of a custom resource, when the condition status is `Unknown`.  Today, the data point cannot be produced due to a parse error:
```
[status,conditions]: [1]: [status]: strconv.ParseFloat: parsing \"Unknown\": invalid syntax
```
The gauge definition is:
```yaml
    - name: "foo_status"
      help: "status condition "
      each:
        type: Gauge
        gauge:
          path: [status, conditions]
          labelsFromPath:
            type: ["type"]
          valueFrom: ["status"]
```

**Why is this needed**:
This is needed to round out the support for status conditions.  `Unknown` is a legit status value and should be supported.

**Describe the solution you'd like**
it isn't totally clear what the gauge value should be. Here's a couple of options:
1. Don't report an error message and skip reporting the data point.  This means that `Unknown` would translate into the absence of a data point.
2. Consider adding a `valueMap` structure to map the status values to a numerical value, e.g.
```yaml
    - name: "foo_status"
      help: "status condition "
      each:
        type: Gauge
        gauge:
          path: [status, conditions]
          labelsFromPath:
            type: ["type"]
          valueFrom: ["status"]
          valueMap:
            - {from: "Unknown", to: 0}
            - {from: "True", to: 1}
            - {from: "False", to: 0}

```

comment.body:
I just ran into this issue and was able to workaround it by using a StateSet

```
- name: status_condition
  each:
    type: StateSet
    stateSet:
      path: [status, conditions]
      labelName: status
      valueFrom: [status]
      list: [True, False, Unknown]
      labelsFromPath:
        type: [type]
```

issue.title: feat: create opt-in kube_persistentvolume_csi_attributes metric

labels.name: cncf-cla: yes
labels.description: Indicates the PR's author has signed the CNCF CLA.

labels.name: size/M
labels.description: Denotes a PR that changes 30-99 lines, ignoring generated files.

labels.name: needs-rebase
labels.description: Indicates a PR cannot be merged because it has merge conflicts with HEAD.

labels.name: triage/accepted
labels.description: Indicates an issue or PR is ready to be actively worked on.

issue.body:
<!--  Thanks for sending a pull request!  Here are some tips for you:
1. If this is your first time, read our contributor guidelines https://git.k8s.io/community/contributors/guide/pull-requests.md#the-pull-request-submit-process and developer guide https://git.k8s.io/community/contributors/devel/development.md#development-guide
2. If you want *faster* PR reviews, read how: https://git.k8s.io/community/contributors/guide/pull-requests.md#best-practices-for-faster-reviews
3. Follow the instructions for writing a release note: https://git.k8s.io/community/contributors/guide/pull-requests.md#write-release-notes-if-needed
4. If the PR is unfinished, see how to mark it: https://git.k8s.io/community/contributors/guide/pull-requests.md#marking-unfinished-pull-requests
-->

**What this PR does / why we need it**:

This PR adds a new volume attributes field for CSI PV in `kube_persistentvolume_info` metric

**How does this change affect the cardinality of KSM**: *(increases, decreases or does not change cardinality)*

- adds a new label for `kube_persistentvolume_info`
- label value should not change often

**Which issue(s) this PR fixes** *(optional, in `fixes #<issue number>(, fixes #<issue_number>, ...)` format, will close the issue(s) when PR gets merged)*:
Fixes #

comment.body:
@dgrisonnet created a new opt-in metric, maybe this is enough to avoid very specific information

also, I rebased with main but the bot did not remove the label, am I missing something?

pull_request.title: build(deps): Bump github.com/prometheus/common from 0.44.0 to 0.45.0
pull_request.body:
Bumps [github.com/prometheus/common](https://github.com/prometheus/common) from 0.44.0 to 0.45.0.
Release notes

Sourced from github.com/prometheus/common's releases.

v0.45.0

What's Changed

  • Adding support for file based configuration of basic auth username in http client config by @​wasim-nihal in prometheus/common#511
  • Bump golang.org/x/net from 0.10.0 to 0.12.0 by @​dependabot in prometheus/common#507
  • Add read-only token permissions by @​pnacht in prometheus/common#490
  • Synchronize common files from prometheus/prometheus by @​prombot in prometheus/common#495
  • Update client_golang by @​SuperQ in prometheus/common#513
  • Bump golang.org/x/oauth2 from 0.8.0 to 0.12.0 by @​dependabot in prometheus/common#514
  • Bump github.com/aws/aws-sdk-go from 1.44.266 to 1.45.18 in /sigv4 by @​dependabot in prometheus/common#515
  • Bump github.com/prometheus/client_golang from 1.15.1 to 1.17.0 in /sigv4 by @​dependabot in prometheus/common#516
  • Bump github.com/stretchr/testify from 1.8.2 to 1.8.4 in /sigv4 by @​dependabot in prometheus/common#493
  • Update golang_protobuf_extensions to v2 by @​Neo2308 in prometheus/common#509
  • Synchronize common files from prometheus/prometheus by @​prombot in prometheus/common#518

issue.body:
Bumps [github.com/prometheus/common](https://github.com/prometheus/common) from 0.44.0 to 0.45.0.
Release notes

Sourced from github.com/prometheus/common's releases.

v0.45.0

What's Changed

  • Adding support for file based configuration of basic auth username in http client config by @​wasim-nihal in prometheus/common#511
  • Bump golang.org/x/net from 0.10.0 to 0.12.0 by @​dependabot in prometheus/common#507
  • Add read-only token permissions by @​pnacht in prometheus/common#490
  • Synchronize common files from prometheus/prometheus by @​prombot in prometheus/common#495

  • Bump github.com/prometheus/client_golang from 1.15.1 to 1.17.0 in /sigv4 by @​dependabot in prometheus/common#516
